body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Ann R. Lockridge Anderson. Father of Harry C. Anderson, Nancy A. Anderson, Herbert L. Anderson, Robert L. Anderson, Mayes Anderson, and Lillian Anderson. Lived in Mayfield, Kentucky. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1845. Attorney in Graves Count in 1850. Presidential elector for the Whig Party in 1852. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1855 to 1857. Owned five enslaved persons in 1860. Served the First Congressional District of Kentucky as an Unconditional Unionist member of the United States House of Representative from 1863 to 1865. Delegate to the Republican National Convention in 1864. Charged with working with General Eleazer A. Paine to extort citizens in and around Paducah, Kentucky in July and August 1864.
